section: To purchase Products or Services based on a Quote provided by Accuray, Distributor will issue a purchase order, which shall include specific references to the quote number of such Quote (the "Purchase Order"). Accuray shall either accept or reject such Purchase Order within two weeks after receipt thereof, with any failure to approve or disapprove of such Purchase Order in such period constituting disapproval. Each purchase of Accuray Components and Interfaces shall be accomplished and a Purchase Order may be accepted by the execution of the Purchase Order by an authorized representative of Accuray.
explanation: This section states that Accuray's failure to respond to a Purchase Order within two weeks constitutes disapproval. However, it also states that each Purchase Order may be accepted by the execution of the Purchase Order by an authorized representative of Accuray. This creates an ambiguity: if Accuray does not respond within two weeks, is the Purchase Order automatically disapproved, or can it still be accepted later if an authorized representative executes it?

section: Distributor shall report promptly and in writing to Accuray any complaints or expressions of dissatisfaction by the Customers to Distributor relating to the Products or Services. Any such reports shall be provided to Accuray via electronic mail to the following address: complaints@accuray.com.
explanation: Section 3.7 requires Distributor to report customer complaints promptly to Accuray via email. However, there is no defined timeframe for 'promptly'. This lack of specificity could lead to disputes regarding whether the distributor acted quickly enough, especially if delays result in damages or other negative consequences.

section: Accuray will defend or settle any action brought against Distributor and shall indemnify and hold Distributor harmless from any liability, damages and expenses (including court costs and reasonable attorneys' fees) to the extent that it is based upon a third-party claim that a Product, as provided by Accuray to Distributor under this Agreement, infringes any patent issued in the United States, Germany, or in the country in which the Customer requested delivery of the Product or any copyright or misappropriates any trade secret, and will pay any costs and damages made in settlement or awarded against Distributor in final decision resulting from any such claim
explanation: This section describes Accuray's indemnity obligations regarding intellectual property infringement. The phrase 'in the country in which the Customer requested delivery of the Product' is ambiguous. It is unclear whether the patent infringement must occur in that specific country, or if the patent can be issued in any country as long as the product was delivered to the specified country. This ambiguity could lead to disputes about the scope of Accuray's indemnity obligations.
